"Cox, Randy" wrote:

> I picked Refactoring - Martin Fowler up at Java One.  The question I
> have
> is:  When you add new class during refactoring, perhaps adding a
> "value
> object" or  "replacing conditional logic with polymorphism" do you
> test it
> through your original JUnit Tests or do you build a new Test class for
> the
> new class.

Both.  Your original tests should still work, so keep them.  But you may
also wish to create new tests for specific pieces of the new class.

Cheers,
    Kevin


--------------A6F317CB111A9E2DF869494B
Content-Type: text/html; charset=us-ascii
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

<!doctype html public "-//w3c//dtd html 4.0 transitional//en">

<blockquote TYPE=CITE><tt>I picked Refactoring - Martin Fowler up at Java
One.  The question I have</tt>
<br><tt>is:  When you add new class during refactoring, perhaps adding
a "value</tt>
<br><tt>object" or  "replacing conditional logic with polymorphism"
do you test it</tt>
<br><tt>through your original JUnit Tests or do you build a new Test class
for the</tt>
<br><tt>new class.</tt></blockquote>
Both.  Your original tests should still work, so keep them. 
But you may also wish to create new tests for specific pieces of the new
class.
<p>Cheers,
<br>    Kevin
<br> </html>
